alert.note: Alert for Clark; Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 3:18AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM MST/615 AM PDT/ THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Arizona and Nevada, including the following counties, in northwest Arizona, Mohave. In Nevada, Clark and Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 615 AM MST /615 AM PDT/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 317 AM MST /317 AM PDT/, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mesquite, Beaver Dam, Littlefield, Overton, Virgin River Gorge, Moapa Town, Moapa Valley, Bunkerville, Logandale, Overton Beach, Virgin River Campground and Valley Of Fire. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
